Struct ObjectHandle<T>

Namespace
osu.Framework.Allocation
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

Wrapper on GCHandle that supports the IDisposable pattern.

public struct ObjectHandle<T> : IDisposable where T : class

Constructors

ObjectHandle(nint, bool)

Recreates an ObjectHandle<T> based on the passed nint. If ownsHandle is true, disposing this object will free the handle.

public ObjectHandle(nint handle, bool ownsHandle = false)

Parameters

handle nint

Handle from a previously constructed ObjectHandle(T, GCHandleType).

ownsHandle bool

Whether this instance owns the underlying GCHandle.

ObjectHandle(T, GCHandleType)

Wraps the provided object with a GCHandle, using the given GCHandleType.

public ObjectHandle(T target, GCHandleType handleType)

Parameters

target T

The target object to wrap.

handleType GCHandleType

The handle type to use.

Properties

Address

The address of target object, if it is allocated and pinned. Otherwise Zero. Note: This is not the same as the Handle.

public nint Address { get; }

Property Value

nint

Handle

The pointer from the GCHandle, if it is allocated. Otherwise Zero.

public nint Handle { get; }

Property Value

nint

IsAllocated 

public bool IsAllocated { get; }

Property Value

bool

Methods

Dispose()

Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

public void Dispose()

GetTarget(out T)

Gets the object being referenced. Returns true if successful and populates target with the referenced object. Returns false If the handle is not allocated or the target is not of type T.

public bool GetTarget(out T target)

Parameters

target T

Populates this parameter with the targeted object.

bool
